productInformation.name: Customer Reviews
productInformation.value: 4.3 4.3 out of 5 stars 32 ratings 4.3 out of 5 stars

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars ITX Motherboard with ATX Features and stability.
reviews.reviewText: I recently upgraded my gaming rig with the ASRock Z790 PG-ITX motherboard, and I couldn't be happier with the results. This motherboard packs a punch in a compact form factor, making it an excellent choice for small form factor builds without compromising on performance.The build quality is outstanding, and the attention to detail is evident. The motherboard's sleek design adds a touch of sophistication to my setup, and the RGB lighting customization options allow me to personalize the aesthetics to match my taste.Performance-wise, the Z790 PG-ITX has exceeded my expectations. The support for the latest processors, high-speed RAM, and PCIe 4.0 capabilities ensure that my system runs smoothly and handles demanding tasks effortlessly. The BIOS is intuitive and user-friendly, making it easy to tweak settings for optimal performance without being overwhelming for those who may be new to system tuning.I particularly appreciate the robust connectivity options this motherboard offers. The inclusion of Thunderbolt and Wi-Fi 6 enhances the versatility of my system, providing high-speed data transfer and a reliable wireless connection for a seamless gaming and productivity experience.ASRock has also incorporated excellent thermal solutions into this motherboard, keeping temperatures in check even during extended gaming sessions. The overall stability and reliability of the Z790 PG-ITX make it a standout choice for gamers and enthusiasts alike.My only con is going to be the motherboard VRM Fan is a tad loud inside my build. (SSUPD Meshroom S) But with a 3rd party software you can control the fan curve and turn it down a bit to be more tolerable.In conclusion, the ASRock Z790 PG-ITX motherboard delivers a perfect blend of performance, aesthetics, and functionality for those looking to build a powerful system in a compact form factor. I highly recommend it to anyone in search of a high-quality motherboard that doesn't compromise on features.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 9, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars ASRock does it again!
reviews.reviewText: I just upgraded from another ASRock mobo that I've had for 5 years. I never had a bit of problems with that mobo. This mobo has THREE Nvme drives and I'm making use of all of them when creating video content. The only think wonky about this board is that the BIOS will not allow you create a simple hardware raid. This may have something to do with the Intel chipset and not the board. It's not a deal breaker not to stripe two of the 3 NVMEs together as the throughput I'm getting is already insane.I'm not an overclocker, but I've played around with some simple overclocking provided by the ASRock dashboard. It works just fine, but I'm still keeping it at the "standard" setting. I like to keep the temps down whenever possible. Anyway, looks like another win for ASRock.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 10, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent choice for ITX case
reviews.reviewText: Excellent choice for an ITX case. Had trouble placing a higher/bulkier profile heat sink on CPU (ie. Mugen Scythe 5). Had to switch to liquid cooled system, such as those offered by Corsair.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 1, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars Broke After Three Weeks
reviews.reviewText: The board had hardware detection issues from the start, requiring a number of tries to detect the m.2 drive, and then later the GPU. Things went well after everything was finally up and running... for about three weeks. One day, the PC froze. After shutting it down, it refused to send a video output. I tried getting the PC back up and running, but finally caved and sent it to a local repair shop. They tested every part, finding them all working... except for the motherboard.I gave Asrock a chance after hearing they'd turned things around. I'll be going with another brand.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 22, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A small form factor ITX with the knockout punch of an ATX..
reviews.reviewText: I built my latest beast PC with this board and it stood up to my expectations. I did a lot of research before my purchase because I needed one with at least 3 nvme M2 ssd slots for my build. I also needed a number of usb3+ expansion ports. It has a lot of expandability, just use a case with a cut out for access to the back of the board to allow you to install 2 of the 3 nvme M2 ssd's. I suggest always using adequate memory so there are no latency issues with multitasking 2- 16's minimal with this board, so you can see how smooth tasks run. I personally use 2- 32's for gaming and video editing. The make of this board is high quality, metal casing and heavy, just what is expected in a serious motherboard.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Z790 Done Right
reviews.reviewText: This is the only Z790 that I've found from a reputable brand (Not Asus), that has TB4, as well this one has 3x M.2 - M key drive slots at full 4.0 speeds, with 5.0 PCIe and far into the 7000MT/s ram support. Really really solid board that has been perfect for my usage and has much of the features of the Z690i MEG at half the price. Had to come to this board after buying the Z660i from ASUS and realizing they designed it to not mount properly with SMDs and solder joints directly below the 115X / 1700 bracket, while no other brand did that. Exceptional work ASROCK!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Very unstable (ASRock Z790 PG-ITX BIOS 5.02)
reviews.reviewText: Despite the most recent bios adding support for Vengeance DDR5 6000Mhz, it in fact does not. Trying to boot with XMP profile enabled or putting it to 6000Mhz causes the system to either crash or boot loop and automatically sets itself to 3600Mhz. RAM runs fine at 4800 but bios documentation says it now supports this kit at 6000 and it does not. Everything else about the motherboard is great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Love this board
reviews.reviewText: Was having some trouble with a ddr4 z690 board so picked this up and moved over to DDR5. More voltage options available, more NVME slots available, and intel killer networking. There's been a few bios revisions since I first got it, and all have only made things better.System is 13600k, 32gb GSkill, RX 6700XT in a Lian-Li Q58. Gaming temps below are rarely above 65c, and fan curve is fairly quiet. It was a bit pricey, but It's a solid board.

Läuft perfekt und stabil und ist für ein ITX MOBO sehr üppig ausgestattet.Den VRM Lüfter kann man simpel in den fan-curves im BIOS regulieren, bis 50% RPM hört man nichts.Es sollte eigentlich jeder Lüfter draufpassen, viel Platz vorhanden und keine super hohen Kühltürme vorhanden.Alle Steckersockel befinden sich am Rand, wie es sich gehört :)Die Diagnose LEDs sind alle rot, war eigentlich auf Ampelfarben eingestellt, nach dem Booten leuchtet aber nichts mehr.Das Board hat einen CMOS-Reset-taster neben den LEDs, allerdings keine PINs zum Rausführen eines Kabels. :(Bios-Bootzeiten: ca. 1 Minute bei Memory Training (einmalig), danach etwa 15 Sekunden (ohne Ultra Fast Boot aktiv).Habe einen 13600k drin, overclocked über 200W Leistung bei Stresstests, stabil und keinerlei Temperaturauffälligkeiten auf dem Board.FYI: Das BIOS hat eine RGB Einstellungsseite (statisch oder ein paar simple Effekte) so dass für ein wenig RBG Beleuchtung keine schrottige RGB Software mehr benötigt wird.Wer die USB Peripherie beim Ausschalten auch aus haben möchte: Bei Asrock nennt sich dies "Deep Sleep" im BIOS.

Choisie à la volée en remplacement d’une MSI Z790 MPG achetée neuve mais reçue d’occasion.Très bonne surprise, d'habitude je ne jure que par Asus ou MSI. (Et Gigabyte autrefois).AsRock a fait de gros progrès depuis le temps, ils se hissent assez haut dans le marché des cartes mères. Autrefois j’ai eu affaire à eux, il y a plus de 15 ans, c’était pas ça.J’ai choisi cette carte pour faire une configuration en ITX, considérée comme de l’entrée de gamme, son prix devrait baisser dans l’année. (Achetée autour des 400+).Le bundle est assez complet comparé à d’autres marques, entre les mains la carte reste lourde et semble de bonne facture et qualité.On dirait qu’AsRock prend la place de Gigabyte doucement mais sûrement, je n’ai pas testé le service client mais il paraît qu’il est bon. Leurs produits sont bien finis, a l’instar de Gigabyte à une époque … (P35 user here).Partie Amazon, faites un effort, l’enveloppe craft pour le transport c’est abusé … On est sur un objet fragile malgré son emballage hein. (Surtout que vous demandez quand même qu’en cas de retour le colis soit bien emballé).
